alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Cook; Lanier (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 2:20PM EDT until March 25 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Cook County in south central Georgia... Southeastern Berrien County in south central Georgia... Northern Lanier County in south central Georgia... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 220 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ray City, or 7 miles southeast of Nashville, moving east at 40 mph. This storm has a history of gusts to 60 mph and ping pong sized hail. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public and Mesonet. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Nashville, Ray City, Meigs, Courthouse, Cottle, Berrien Co A/P, New Lois, Allenville, Weber, Bannockburn and Teeterville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
